---

## What is Nostr?

Nostr (Notes and Other Stuff Transmitted by Relays) is a simple, open protocol that enables global, decentralized, and censorship-resistant social media. It uses cryptographic keypairs for identity, simple event objects for data, and relay servers for distribution.

## What is Nostrbook?

Nostrbook serves as a central registry of well-structured, detailed documentation about all aspects of the Nostr protocol. While the official [NIPs repository](https://github.com/nostr-protocol/nips) defines the specifications, Nostrbook expands upon them with:

- Clearer explanations
- Structured navigation
- Detailed examples
- Cross-references between related concepts
- Consistent formatting

This makes it easier for developers, users, and even AI systems to understand and work with Nostr.

## Key Concepts

<div class="vp-features">
  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>Events</h3>
      <p>The fundamental data structure in Nostr. Every piece of information is an event with a consistent structure including content, metadata, and a cryptographic signature.</p>
      <a href="/protocol/event">Learn about Event Structure ‚Üí</a>
    </article>
  </div>

  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>Relays</h3>
      <p>Servers that store and forward events. Users can choose which relays to publish to and read from, creating a resilient and decentralized network.</p>
    </article>
  </div>

  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>Filters</h3>
      <p>Query parameters that allow clients to request specific events from relays based on various criteria like authors, event types, or content references.</p>
      <a href="/protocol/filter">Understand Filters ‚Üí</a>
    </article>
  </div>

  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>NIPs</h3>
      <p>Nostr Implementation Possibilities - documents that specify protocol extensions and conventions that allow the ecosystem to evolve.</p>
    </article>
  </div>
</div>

## For AI and Programmatic Access

Nostrbook conforms to the [llms.txt specification](https://llmstxt.org/), making its content easily accessible for AI agents and programmatic tools. All documentation is available in markdown format by appending `.md` to any page URL:

<div class="vp-features">
  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>Model Context Protocol (MCP)</h3>
      <p>Nostrbook now provides a <a href="/mcp">Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration</a> that allows AI tools to access Nostr documentation directly through function calls, without relying on training data or scraping.</p>
      <p>With the MCP extension, AI assistants can:</p>
      <ul>
        <li>Read NIPs directly from the official repository</li>
        <li>Access structured kind and tag documentation</li>
        <li>Get up-to-date protocol information</li>
      </ul>
      <a href="/mcp">Learn about Nostr MCP Integration ‚Üí</a>
    </article>
  </div>

  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>llms.txt File</h3>
      <p>Our <a href="/llms.txt">llms.txt</a> file at the root of the site provides a structured overview of key resources for AI agents, including:</p>
      <ul>
        <li>Project overview and context</li>
        <li>Links to most important documentation</li>
        <li>Logical organization of content</li>
      </ul>
    </article>
  </div>

  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>Markdown Endpoints</h3>
      <p>Access clean, structured markdown versions of any page by appending <code>.md</code> to URLs:</p>
      <ul>
        <li><code>/kinds/1.md</code> - Text Note kind in markdown</li>
        <li><code>/tags/e.md</code> - Event reference tag in markdown</li>
        <li><code>/protocol/event.md</code> - Event structure in markdown</li>
      </ul>
    </article>
  </div>

  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>Directory Index Files</h3>
      <p>Access directory indexes in markdown format:</p>
      <ul>
        <li><code>/kinds/index.md</code> - All event kinds</li>
        <li><code>/tags/index.md</code> - All tags</li>
        <li><code>/protocol/index.md</code> - Protocol documentation</li>
      </ul>
    </article>
  </div>

  <div class="vp-feature-item">
    <article class="vp-feature-text">
      <h3>Programmatic Usage</h3>
      <p>AI agents can programmatically construct URLs to find information:</p>
      <ul>
        <li>For kind <em>N</em>: <code>/kinds/N.md</code></li>
        <li>For tag <em>T</em>: <code>/tags/T.md</code></li>
        <li>For protocol doc: <code>/protocol/SECTION.md</code></li>
      </ul>
    </article>
  </div>
</div>

}

    grid-template-columns: 1fr;
  }
}
</style>
